inserted.#text: 558  (13 February 2018).  Where is the funding cut from the Health Consumers Alliance being reallocated?

talker.name: The Hon. D.C. VAN HOLST PELLEKAAN

by.#text: The Hon. D.C. VAN HOLST PELLEKAAN (Stuartâ€”Minister for Energy and Mining):

inserted.#text: The Minister for Health and Wellbeing has been advised:

text.inserted: In state budget setting processes, the prioritisation of funding is assessed on a whole, therefore, there is no specific reallocation of funding that was otherwise directed to the Health Consumers Alliance.

However, in line with other savings initiatives from the 2018-19 state budget, the funding has been reinvested back into the health system with such operating initiatives, including the $800 million investment over the forward estimates to establish a sustainable, efficient health system.
